entries.name: Prospect Park
entries.summary: Large park with Long Meadow and Nethermead — several off-leash hours and designated areas.
entries.notes: Community rangers enforce rules; avoid sports fields.

entries.name: McCarren Park
entries.summary: Popular Williamsburg/Greenpoint park; dog area and mixed-use paths.
entries.notes: Busy; check local signage for temporary restrictions.

entries.name: Domino Park
entries.summary: East Williamsburg waterfront park with a small dog run and off-leash-friendly spots.
entries.notes: Great views of Manhattan; dog run is fenced and popular.

entries.name: Brooklyn Bridge Park
entries.summary: Waterfront park along the East River with dog runs and leashed walking paths.
entries.notes: Great skyline views; runs can be crowded in evenings.

entries.name: Fort Greene Park
entries.summary: Historic Brooklyn park with green lawns and community-managed dog areas.

entries.name: Flushing Meadows–Corona Park
entries.summary: Huge park with Meadow Lake and Willow Lake; select off-leash hours in certain areas.
entries.notes: Avoid events during large sports tournaments.

entries.name: Astoria Park
entries.summary: Scenic park under the RFK Bridge; popular for dog walks along the waterfront.
entries.notes: Very busy in summer; avoid pool vicinity.

entries.name: Forest Park
entries.summary: Large wooded park with trails and bridle paths; dogs must be leashed on most trails.
entries.notes: Good for quiet hikes with leashed dogs.

entries.name: Socrates Sculpture Park
entries.summary: Outdoor art park in Long Island City; leashed dogs welcome.
entries.notes: Great cultural space; dogs must be leashed.

entries.name: Gantry Plaza State Park
entries.summary: Beautiful waterfront park with Manhattan skyline views; dogs allowed on leash.
entries.notes: Very popular with families; keep leash short.
